intro: Serratula heterophilla, commonly known as the slender sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its finely divided, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Serratula heterophilla is often found in open plains and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
